page.title: 19Waste Disposal
page.content: The Wem sewage works is just by the station. It takes 2 men to run it. They wear a water proof jacket and trousers, wellingtons, safety hats and safety equipment.Everything goes down to the sewage works for treatment. The solid material is taken to Shrewsbury but the liquid is filtered and run into the River Roden. They sometimes recover odd things like false teeth and return them to their owners. The present rubbish tip is at the S.E. corner of the area. It is about 5 acres in size. The dustmen work for N. Shropshire Council and collect 21,794 dustbins from shops, houses,garages and pubs in that area every week. The 9 lorries are based at Shawbury. The present tipwill only last to the end of this year. Then all the rubbish will have to go 5 miles away to a new tip at Prees.
